meanings.definition: The act of traveling on foot.
meanings.sent1: Pedestrianism is common in crowded cities where traffic is heavy.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy the simplicity of pedestrianism when exploring new neighborhoods.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner joked that his pedestrianism was faster than rush hour traffic.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to pedestrianism was like a steady river flowing through the bustling city streets.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of pedestrianism lies in the freedom to stop and admire the surroundings at any moment.

meanings.definition: The practice of walking as a form of exercise or transportation.
meanings.sent1: Pedestrianism can be a great way to stay active without needing any equipment.
meanings.sent2: In some countries, pedestrianism is the primary mode of getting around town.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends turned their daily walks into a fun pedestrianism competition.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to pedestrianism was like a silent dance on the city sidewalks.
meanings.sent5: The benefits of pedestrianism include improved cardiovascular health and reduced stress levels.
